result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam L. Bladow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea and Sentencing Hearing 12/18/15

Defendant Adam L. Bladow in court with attorney Brian Severson.  Defendant Adam L. Bladow in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and State states appearances and status.  Atty Severson acknowledges rec. complaint in 15CF447 and waives reading.  Ready to waive right to prelim today.  DE agrees to waive prelim.  Court questions DE on waiver of prelim in 15CF447/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.  Atty Severson acknowledges rec. information, waives reading NC plea entered to Ct 1 in 15CF447 and Ct 2 in 15CF49.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  Court advises DE of felony firearms warnings and voting rights.  State makes statement re: sentencing.  Atty Severson makes statement on behalf of DE.  Court sentences.

15CF447

3 years prison (1 year Initial Confinement and 2 years Extended Supervision)
Consecutive to any other sentence and to commence FORTHWITH

Revoke DL 36 months
IID 36 months effective upon licensure

Not to operate MV w/o valid DL

DNA sample to be provided
Ct 2:  Dismissed

Ct 2:  NC

Defendant Adam L. Bladow by video from LEC with attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day.  Defendant Adam L. Bladow in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  DE hasn't applied for PD appt yet.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State requests cash bond.  Atty Meyer-O'Day responds.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $500.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact w/N.H., absolute sobriety at all times from drugs and alcohol, not to go to bars/taverns/liquor stores and must submit to testing if requested to do so by law enforcement.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 08:45 am.  Return date scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
